title: Can it be an auto ban to say "Its just flex" and proceed to fk around
body:
Its annoying as fuckign shit these days to play flex queue without every single game getting someone who says "its just flex", as they proceed to feed and fk around and troll because "its just flex".

Its RANKED, play it like its ranked. Riot really needs to be stricter with people who say shit like shit like shti and then proceed to just troll. As it completely devalues the queue and turns it into basically normal games. As people just fk around because they dont treat it as ranked.

replies.body:
Flex is normal draft with worse matchmaking.

Stop acting like it is a real Ranked queue.
If you want to play Ranked play SoloQ.
Well, if it isn't a real Ranked queue, you might wanna ask Riot to remove the word "Ranked" from the name.

They might as well do that, or remove the queue completely and give us back teamranked.

FlexQ is basically DynamicQ, only that we aren't forced to play it anymore.
That the concept of DynamicQ didn't and will never work should be clear now, after we, + all pros, had to literally fight against Riot an entire season to finally get them to realize that.

But now we have SoloQ back, so nobody cares about Flex/DynamicQ anymore, and now the queue is just there for no reason.
The concept of putting premade and solo performance combined in one queue simply won't work to measure skill, and on top of that the queue has so bad matchmaking because often players actual SoloQ Rank is so far above their Flex Rank, it feels like a match full of smurfs.
I'm so often having Flex games where I just feel like getting shit on by matchmaking, or the other way around, that I don't why any people in this game would take that queue more seriously than norms.

So just give us back teamranked and get rid of this last remainder of DynamicQ.

If nobody cares about Flex Queue, then there wouldn't be people playing in it - even if only to bullshit around. Beyond that, Season 7 set a precedent where now Flex Queue is indisputably worth climbing in, since now you can get unique Chromas for the Victorious skin per queue.

IMO, if you don't take Flex 5's (or to a potentially similar extent, Flex 3's) seriously, just don't play those gamemodes. Don't ruin it for the people who do take it seriously - especially _now_, since there is actually something to achieve in them.

I usually only play it rarely, if I'm in a premade and we are actually able to queue together in Flex.
Often the reason for that is because I'm still in Flex Gold, so I'm able to carry my friends into the season reward elo.
We won't take it more seriously than normals, but if it's normals with a reward, why should we play normal instead of Flex?
See the problem with the queue? That's exactly the attitude 80% of the people in Flex, and nobody can blame anyone for that but Riot.

The reason why people play it is for the rewards, but you can't expect people to take it seriously.

I think I'm more likely to blame the community for having the mindset than Riot somehow inadvertently creating the mindset. I'm probably a whole different category of competitive player, but I honestly think the mindset should be this:

"It is basically Normals with a reward attached, but it's not as important to me as Solo/Duo, so if I do decide to play it, I'll climb until I can reasonably get the reward, and then leave others to compete for their own while I return to my other modes so that I neither jeopardise my own reward in it nor harm other peoples' climbs"

But, that's just not a rationale anyone's going to take - probably not even in an ideal world.

I suppose my biggest problem with that mindset you propose:

> We won't take it more seriously than normals, but if it's normals with a reward, why should we play normal instead of Flex?

Is that people are missing a pretty sizeable chunk of info that should go into the logic. That Normals has no real stakes, whereas Ranked Flex 5's actually has risks and stakes involved. There's criteria to be met, and if you fall below those criteria, you won't get the reward.

If people don't want to take things seriously, then why are they playing a gamemode with stakes involved? Why aren't they just playing Normals? If there's a reward to be had, why are you half-assing your way to getting it?

Ultimately, I can't blame Riot for the community's mindset on Flex 5's, and outside of clear cases of trolling or feeding, I know that the loathesome people who don't put their all into Flex 5's simply because "it's just flex" aren't in a position to be punished, as they're still somewhat in it to win.

But, I can still sure as shit sit here and seethe over the fact that the community generally refuses to take anything but Solo/Duo seriously.

It's simply because we know we are going to climb anyway in that queue, even if it's slower than when going 100% tryhard.
That's not really risks and stakes, but more like a matter of time.
So if sooner or later anyone is gold and gets the extra reward, all gucci.

And it's not like that I'm just trolling around all game, I just don't take it as seriously as trying to win a 3-20 game by dragging it to late game. Things like trying out a new champion and things like that are the things I'm speaking of here when I'm saying I don't take it more seriously as norms. Just the usual chilling, talking about shit and rekking some noobz. Some games just don't go that way, and these are the games when I'm just like "It's just Flex anyway, let's go next" instead of trying to comeback. Also, I generally don't really get any feelings of a fair challenge in that mode. In my last Flex game, there were players with Ranks from Silver 2 to Diamond 5. That's also a reason why you simply can't take it seriously.

But honestly if we sit in there and you have some dude there (usually a solo player) that cries around all game, I wonder why these dudes don't just play SoloQ. You can't really blame the community for not taking a queue seriously where you have players from all elos put together, and call it a fair match. If anyone is to blame for that, it's Riot for trying to keep the failed experiment called DynamicQ alive, and make people able to gain not only the main season reward, but also an exclusive reward for it. Ofc that gets people into the queue that actually don't care about their Rank there, and just play it because it's normals with a reward at the end of the season.

People say "its just X lol" in everything.

It is just their excuse to be garbage, has no effect on if they get punished for being garbage or not. Let them have it.
